meanings.definition: To dry by exposure to air or heat.
meanings.sent1: I will updry the wet clothes by hanging them outside.
meanings.sent2: After washing the dishes, I always updry them with a towel.
meanings.sent3: The sun decided to updry the puddles after the rain stopped.
meanings.sent4: Her warm smile seemed to updry the tears in his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The desert sun can updry a river in no time.

meanings.sent1: The wind will updry the spilled water on the floor.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the windows open will help the wet carpet updry faster.
meanings.sent3: The magic spell accidentally updry the entire lake!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to updry her enthusiasm for the project.
meanings.sent5: The fire's heat can updry the damp wood for burning.

meanings.sent1: Using a hairdryer can updry the wet paint on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The dehumidifier helps to updry the air in the room.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers can updry any wet surface instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to updry the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays can updry the morning dew on the grass.
